text: uh hi everyone
flamatarian here the internet's busiest
music nerd and it's time for a review of
this new Natalia lafourcade record De
todas Las Flores this is the latest
full-length LP from one of Mexico's best
who is quickly following up the two
volume experience that she released last
year uncanto por Mexico which featured
loads of songs instrumental palettes and
guest artists that allowed Natalya to
explore her Mexican heritage musically
speaking in a profound way with higher
production value than she had ever had
before while these are not my favorite
projects she has released thus far there
still are a lot of amazing songs on
these records I definitely came away
from these LPS admiring their ambition
even if that ended up uh giving us some
instrumentals that felt maybe a bit too
sanitized or methodically produced and
put together to the point where it's
like it's super clean like something out
of a Disney soundtrack which is not
entirely surprising given Natalia's
connections to the Disney friend
franchise but historically at least for
me it's her more rustic records that end
up really doing it for me that is what I
get the most out of and de todos Las
Flores is one of those records but this
record simultaneously continues to show
the instrumental ambition that we heard
on Natalya's past couple of albums but
now the performances and the
orchestrations feel much more loose and
Lively wild and exciting it's a bold and
beautiful record and a really thorough
one too considering the 12 tracks on
this thing span over an hour in run time
there are also a good handful of songs
on this thing that push past six minutes
easily thanks to some really patient
intros extended instrumental passages as
well as just a lot of great chemistry
between Natalia and her band the whole
thing just feels very lightning in a
bottle especially during moments like
when Natalya's vocals are hitting on the
first vocal line of vinay Solita which
not only sounds very beautiful and
intimate yes but you can also hear the
sound of her voice bouncing off the
walls of the room she's recording it
which is also the case to a lesser
degree for some of the other
instrumentation too it's kind of like
you're sitting in on a really cool
studio session for the album and let me
say sonically the record is engineered
beautifully it sounds so freaking good
and clear and well balanced even through
a phone speaker I could even make out
the upright bass super clearly like
whoever engineered this thing is a
God because again everything
going on on this LP translates so well
even though there are spots and Pockets
that are meant to be a little chaotic
and a little messy as far as the musical
style of this LP is concerned it's not
too much unlike Natalia's most recent
works it's a mixed bag of Bops and
ballads that touch down on numerous
shades of Latin music but a super
versatile band allows her to take these
Styles and fuse them a little bit with
elements of chamber music and Jazz but
honestly one of the best things about
this record isn't so much Natalya
playing musical Anthropologist or
curator as she has on previous records
because I think de todos Las Flores
plays more toward emotion than anything
else truly because the feelings on this
record at least for me are so incredibly
potent much more than any album she's
released thus far in this vein like with
the intimacy and heart-wrenching power
found in the subtlety of the opener I
think the beauty of Natalya's voice on
this track should be enough to bring
anyone to their knees the hypnotizing
title tracks sweet vocal Melodies and
subtle little grooves make me feel like
I am having a passionate Tango session
going on in my head plus the way the
background instrumentation and vocal
harmonies uh swell and grow along the
progression of the track it's so
incremental that by the time it's like
fully on you're barely even realizing
what's going on and you're just kind of
engrossed in it there's also the
devastating sadness of pasandos Dias the
endlessly dramatic tension of ivame
viento which begins simply as many cuts
on this LP do but gradually the entire
track turns into this beautiful and
cacophonous rainfall of percussion piano
acoustic guitar horns the second half
sees it all coalescing into kind of a
loose linear Groove I wish this portion
of the song had a stronger I guess a 0.8
point B to it it ends a little
inconsequentially meanwhile El Lugar
correcto is a passionate and
methodically performed number meant for
the dance floor lots of orchestration
surrounding it too this is one of a few
tracks that feels very close
aesthetically to many songs on uh
uncanto but the final production touches
don't come across as being too stiff or
too clean or over produced also the
track Camina Bonito scratches a similar
itch too pajarito Colibri is a beautiful
and gentle number that is as graceful as
the hummingbird the song is about the
weepy little Melodies on the chorus are
some of the catchiest on the entire
record too and then the grooves return
in a big way on Maria la conendera this
track instrumentally emotionally burning
it's sultry the piano guitar and Horn
parts are so hot you're gonna sweat and
I guess it makes sense given the
metaphorical lyrics on the cut about
dealing with pain having it burn away
fire taking away that pain and then new
flowers or opportunities or hopes or
life kind of growing in a place of that
the chilling spoken word passages all
over Muerte are very much about the
various things that Natalia has learned
from Death uh her own mortality that
kind of influencing her to value and
think about life differently this
portion of the track stands out is very
unique and tense in comparison with the
rest of the record however I do love how
it really comes together with the
background vocal harmonies and gets much
sweeter and more harmonious in the
second half the band's really cooking on
this one too with some of those horn and
piano improvs meanwhile the dancing
upright bass line as well as the little
horn embellishments on Canta La Arena
make this track a light and sweet
contrast from the previous one for the
closer we have a super sweet acoustic
number that sends the album off with the
most gentle of touches songwriting wise
this one is not sticking with me as much
as many other cuts on the record but I
suppose was you know as a mood as a Vibe
as a sentiment which again I think this
album is just very much about that we
haven't quite Hit Upon something like
this yet at this point in the track list
and I suppose if you were going to
feature this kind of feeling it works
best toward the end give us a calm after
this incredible incredible run of tracks
honestly but yeah
um this is quickly becoming one of my
favorite Natalia records uh period even
with the muses albums being as amazing
as they were like for me this album is
truly like top five of the Year material
easily it's that stunning it's that
gorgeous it's that well performed it's
that well put together it is that deeply
cutting emotionally and it's it's it's
just that it's just that pretty it's
just that pretty but yeah absolutely
loving this a couple of moments here and
there that I was not super crazy about
the the way they progressed but outside
of that fire record fire album
um again one of one of Natalia's best
one of the best of the a year and would
easily give this thing a decent too
strong nine transition have you given
this album well listen did you love it
did you hate it what would you rate it
you're the best you're the best what
should I review next hit the like if you
like Please Subscribe and please don't
cry hit the Bell as well over here next
to my head is another video that you can
